herbs_and_spices

 • This file provides short, controlled Ayurvedic references for commonly used
 herbs and spices.
 • Each item includes: Dosha effect →Benefits →When to avoid.

Use this for:

 • Kadha formulation
 • Disease-specific suggestions
 • Dosha-safe substitutions
 • Safety warnings

1. GINGER (Adraka / Shunthi)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha, mild Vata
 • Aggravates: Pitta (heat)

Benefits

 • Improves digestion (Agni)
 • Reduces nausea
 • Clears cold, cough, congestion
 • Enhances circulation

Avoid When

 • Pitta heat, ulcers, acidity
 • Heavy menstrual bleeding

2. TURMERIC (Haldi)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha, Pitta (mildly)
 • Can aggravate: Vata a little (drying)

Benefits

 • Anti-inflammatory
 • Antimicrobial
 • Improves skin and digestion

 1

• Supports immunity

Avoid When

 • Gallbladder obstruction
 • Very dry Vata (use with ghee)

3. CINNAMON (Dalchini)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Vata, Kapha
 • Aggravates: Pitta (warming)

Benefits

 • Improves metabolism
 • Controls blood sugar
 • Clears mucus
 • Stimulates circulation

Avoid When

 • High Pitta heat, acidity
 • Bleeding disorders (in excess)

4. TULSI (Holy Basil)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha, Vata
 • Slightly increases Pitta

Benefits

 • Anti-viral, anti-cold
 • Reduces cough and congestion
 • Improves respiration
 • Mild stress-relief

Avoid When

 • High Pitta heat

 2

• Pregnancy (excess)

5. ASHWAGANDHA

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Vata
 • Neutral: Pitta
 • Can increase: Kapha (heavy)

Benefits

 • Strengthens immunity
 • Reduces stress, anxiety
 • Enhances sleep quality
 • Boosts strength & stamina

Avoid When

 • Kapha congestion
 • Thyroid hyperactivity
 • Pregnancy (consult required)

6. TRIPHALA

Dosha Effect

 • Balances all three doshas
 • Slightly drying →can increase Vata

Benefits

 • Best Ayurvedic bowel tonic
 • Improves digestion & detox
 • Mild antioxidant
 • Supports eye health

Avoid When

 • Severe diarrhea
 • Very dry Vata constipation (use with ghee)

 3

7. MULETHI (Licorice)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Vata, Pitta
 • Increases: Kapha

Benefits

 • Soothes throat
 • Supports respiratory health
 • Useful for acidity
 • Mildly rejuvenating

Avoid When

 • High blood pressure
 • Water retention
 • Kapha congestion

8. BLACK PEPPER (Kali Mirch)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha
 • Slightly increases: Vata, Pitta

Benefits

 • Strong digestive stimulant
 • Enhances absorption (bioavailability)
 • Clears mucus
 • Anti-microbial

Avoid When

 • Ulcers
 • High Pitta acidity
 • Dry Vata conditions

 4

9. CUMIN (Jeera)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha, Pitta
 • Neutral for Vata

Benefits

 • Improves digestion
 • Reduces gas and bloating
 • Supports lactation
 • Mild detoxifying

Avoid When

 • No major contraindications
 • Use mildly in very dry Vata

10. FENNEL (Saunf)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Pitta, Vata
 • Neutral/mildly increasing: Kapha

Benefits

 • Best cooling spice
 • Reduces acidity
 • Improves digestion without heat
 • Good for breath + bloating

Avoid When

 • Excess Kapha congestion (don’t overuse)

11. CARDAMOM (Elaichi)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Pitta, Vata
 • Neutral for Kapha

 5

Benefits

 • Reduces acidity
 • Lightens heavy foods
 • Good for breath
 • Mild digestive aid

Avoid When

 • No strong contraindications
 • Very dry Vata may need moisture

12. CLOVE (Laung)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha
 • Increases: Pitta slightly
 • Neutral: Vata

Benefits

 • Antimicrobial
 • Improves digestion
 • Useful in toothache
 • Clears mucus

Avoid When

 • High Pitta heat
 • Ulcers

13. GARLIC (Lahsun)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha, Vata
 • Increases: Pitta strongly

Benefits

 • Strong antimicrobial
 • Improves circulation

 6

• Reduces cholesterol
 • Good for gas + digestion

Avoid When

 • Pitta heat
 • Acidity & ulcers
 • Spiritual fasting (traditional restriction)

14. AJWAIN (Carom Seeds)

Dosha Effect

 • Pacifies: Kapha, Vata
 • Increases: Pitta (heat)

Benefits

 • Best for gas & bloating
 • Improves digestion
 • Helps cold congestion
 • Antimicrobial

Avoid When

 • High Pitta acidity
 • Ulcers
